Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: Hopkins Schools financial aid program is need-based. Families interested in receiving financial aid fill out an application form and submit it to the school. In addition to the application, families are required to provide additional financial documents, including but not limited to complete copies of individual income tax returns and forms W-2. A Financial Aid Committee reviews the information and determines the level of financial aid award, if any. Any financial aid award is for one year at a time. All recipients must complete the full application process each year. In general, financial aid applications are due in January and financial aid awards are made in March. Financial aid is not a cash grant award. Actual financial aid awards are reflected as credits toward tuition.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: Barbara Riley, Head of School, as a condition of employment in order to properly discharge her responsibilities, and for the convenience of the School, is required to reside local to the School. In consideration thereof, Ms. Riley receives a housing allowance of $35,300 per year and a utility allowance of $5,000 per year. In addition, Ms. Riley receives $2,500 per year as an allowance for social club dues so she has access to arrange social functions and events of benefit to the School.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 2
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Trustees David Newton and William Ginsberg have a business relationship. David Newton serves on the Board of Trustees of a not for profit organization that employs William Ginsberg.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The 990 is made available to Trustees as requested after it is filed. The Audit Committee of the Trustees reviews the 990 after it is filed.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Hopkins provides the conflict of interest policy to trustees and key employees on an annual basis. This policy is reviewed at a Trustee meeting. All Trustees and key employees sign a conflict of interest annual certificate of acknowledgement annually.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Head of Schools compensation is set by contract. This contract typically runs for a three year period. At the outset of the contract, compensation is determined by a subset of Trustees including the President. Benchmark and comparative data gleaned from a variety of sources including the National Association of Independent Schools and other regionalized surveys are used to determine a market based rate of compensation. For subsequent years of the contract (years 2 and 3), annual compensation is escalated at a rate consistent with annual percentage increases for faculty and staff. Other than the Head of School, the Chief Financial and Operating Officer is the only other key employee as defined by the IRS definitions. Compensation for the Chief Financial and Operating Officer is set by contract. This contract runs for a single twelve month period. Rates of compensation under this contact are set annually by the Head of School in consultation with Trustees. Benchmark and comparative data gleaned from a variety of sources including the National Association of Independent Schools and other regionalized surveys are used to determine a market based rate of compensation.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 18
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Form 1023, Form990 and Form 990T are made available for public inspection upon request.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Organizations governing documents, conflict of interest policy, and financial statements are generally not made available for public inspection since the documents are considered to be internal information.
